required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Special Drug Use Investigation for PAXIL Tablet (Pediatric Panic Disorder)
clinical_study.official_title: Special Drug Use Investigation for PAXIL Tablet (Pediatric Panic Disorder)

brief_summary.textblock: The objectives of this survey was to retrospectively collect and evaluate the information on the efficacy and safety of PAXIL tablets ("PAXIL", hereinafter) in pediatric subjects (aged under 18) with panic disorder under conditions of actual use.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse events in Japanese pediatric subjects with panic disorder treated with paroxetine tablet based on prescribing information under the conditions of general clinical practice
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the starting day of the treatment to the time of treatment termination/discontinuation was assessed from 1 month at minimum up to 2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy evaluation based on overall improvement
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the starting day of the treatment to the time of treatment termination/discontinuation was assessed from 1 month at minimum up to 2 years

arm_group.description: Pediatric subjects with panic disorder prescribed PAXIL during study period

study_pop.textblock: Male and female Japanese subjects whose age is under 18 with panic disorder, who are considered appropriate to prescribe paroxetine tablet according to the prescribing information

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged under 18 at the time of the panic disorder diagnosis
- Aged under 18 on the starting day of PAXIL treatment
- Having been making periodic visits to the hospital to receive treatment for panic disorder
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who have been treated with paroxetine prior to this investigation
- Subjects with hypersensitivity to paroxetine
- Subjects taking monoamine oxidase inhibitors (MAOIs) or within 2 weeks of stopping treatment with MAOIs
- Concomitant use in patients taking pimozide
